content.description: Climb a thinner face to gain the ledge. Move out right and pull over a small roof. Continue up the headwall on decent holds, some scarier than others, to a final traverse up and left to the chains.
content.location: First route once around the corner in the amphitheater. Starts at the arÃªte at the bottom, but quickly transitions to the middle of the face to the ledge.

content.description:
Climb the technical, yet strenuous, face on hard crimps and shallow pockets to a steeper crux at the top with even harder crimps.

Good luck finding any beta that makes this 11+
content.location: On the more vertical left side of the wall, just right of a large boulder, this climbs up the pocketed face to the left of a black conglomeration embedded in the wall about 15 feet up.

climbs.name: Grandpa Philly
climbs.fa: Zack Henderson, Carl Virost, Erica Goldberg, Mike Wheatley

content.description: Start off to the right side for an easier start and work your way up a nice dihedral with good feet.
content.location: Tiny crack runs up to anchors on a ledge.

content.description:
Your lockdown fingerboard training will pay off as you crimp your way through the first few bolts. Enjoy the break of moderate climbing to a great rest that you will need. You will still need to try from here to the anchors.

Shares anchors with Booya. A 60m rope will get you down but a 70 is recommended.

Equipped by Scott Curran
content.location: Farthest route right on the wall. Follow the path around the big boulder to the base of the climb
